thread.title: Stephen Jones: Latest health update on Cowboys' Dez Bryant
thread.title_full: Stephen Jones: Latest health update on Cowboys' Dez Bryant | Dallas Morning News

author: Jon Machota
title: Stephen Jones: Latest health update on Cowboys' Dez Bryant
text:
Although Dez Bryant didn't practice Friday, he hasn't been completely ruled out of Sunday's game against the New York Giants.
The Cowboys star wide receiver was listed as doubtful on Friday's official injury report but Cowboys executive vice president Stephen Jones said they'll take the final decision all the way down to Sunday before the game.
"He's got some work to do if he's going to be able to play," Jones said Friday on 105.3 The Fan's Ben and Skin show [KRLD-FM]. "We'll probably take a look at him when we get to [MetLife Stadium] and make our final decision. At the same time, we want to make sure that we make the right call, and we know that we still have a long season ahead of us.
"We'll see when we get there and see how he's feeling, see how sore he is. He's been doing a lot of work this week, so see if some of that soreness kind of goes away on him, see if he would feel good about it and then see how he might warm up. But right now, we'll just have to wait and see how it goes."
Bryant, who fractured his right foot in the season opener, worked off to the side jogging and catching passes during the portion of Thursday's practice open to the media. But he was listed as a non participant on the practice report every day this week, meaning he didn't take part in team drills.
"We're not ruling anybody out," Cowboys coach Jason Garrett said Thursday. "We take him day by day. We take him all the way to the game."
